Package vinyl

Class RecordStream

java.lang.Object
vinyl.RecordStream
All Implemented Interfaces:
AutoCloseable, BaseStream<Record,Stream<Record>>, Stream<Record>
public class RecordStream extends Object implements Stream<Record>
A stream of records with a common header. In addition to the usual stream operations, a RecordStream supports several relational-style operations that yield a new RecordStream with a new header and transformed records. A record-stream's header can always be safely accessed via header(), even after the stream has been operated on.

    • header

      public Header header()
      Returns the header shared by all records at this stage in the stream pipeline.

    • concat

      public static RecordStream concat(RecordStream a, RecordStream b)
      Concatenates the input record-streams to form a new record-stream, similarly to Stream.concat, as long as the input stream headers are equal. If the headers are not equal, throws IllegalArgumentException.
      Parameters:
      a - the first stream
      b - the second stream
      Returns:
      the concatenation of the two input streams
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the input stream headers are not equal
      See Also:
      • Stream.concat(Stream, Stream)

      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the stream elements
      Parameters:

      Returns:

    • toRecordSet

      public RecordSet toRecordSet()
      Accumulates the records of this stream into a RecordSet. The records in the set will be in this stream's encounter order, if one exists. The record-set will have the same header as this stream.

      This is a terminal operation.

      Returns:
      a record-set containing the stream records

    • aux

      public RecordStream.Aux<Record> aux()
      Converts this stream to an auxiliary object stream consisting of the records of this stream.
      Returns:
      an auxiliary object stream

    • select

      public RecordStream select(Consumer<SelectAPI> config)
      Returns a stream that maps each record in this stream to a new record, as configured by the given configurator consumer. The returned stream will have a new header, shared by the new records.

      This is a stateless intermediate operation, by default. If windows are configured, this becomes a stateful intermediate operation.

      Parameters:
      config - a consumer that configures the output fields
      Returns:
      a stream that maps each record in this stream to a new record

    • aggregate

      public RecordStream aggregate(Consumer<AggregateAPI> config)
      Returns a stream that aggregates the records in this stream, possibly within grouped partitions. Each partition will result in one record in the returned stream. The grouping and aggregation are carried out as configured by the given configurator consumer. The returned stream will have a new header, shared by the new records.

      This is a stateful intermediate operation.

      Parameters:
      config - a consumer that configures the aggregate operation
      Returns:
      a stream that aggregates the records in this stream

    • join

      public RecordStream join(RecordStream right, Function<JoinAPI.On,JoinPred> onConfig, Consumer<JoinAPI.Select> selectConfig)
      Returns a stream that performs an inner join between this (left) stream and the given right stream. The join streams the left-side, and for each left-side record, searches the right-side for matching records such that the (left, right) pair of records satisfy the configured join condition. When a match is found, a resulting record is created as configured and emitted downstream. The returned stream will have a new header, shared by the new records.

      For an inner join, if a given left-side record does not match any right-side records, or vice versa, nothing is emitted downstream.

      This is a stateless intermediate operation on the left stream, and a stateful intermediate operation on the right stream. Upon close(), the returned stream closes both input streams.

      Parameters:
      right - the right-side stream
      onConfig - a function that configures the join condition
      selectConfig - a consumer that configures the output fields
      Returns:
      the new stream

    • leftJoin

      public RecordStream leftJoin(RecordStream right, Function<JoinAPI.On,JoinPred> onConfig, Consumer<JoinAPI.Select> selectConfig)
      Returns a stream that performs a left outer join between this (left) stream and the given right stream. The join streams the left-side, and for each left-side record, searches the right-side for matching records such that the (left, right) pair of records satisfy the configured join condition. When a match is found, a resulting record is created as configured and emitted downstream. The returned stream will have a new header, shared by the new records.

      For a left join, if a given left-side record does not match any right-side records, it is paired with a nil right-side record, and a resulting record is created as configured and emitted downstream. If a right-side record does not match any left-side records, nothing is emitted downstream.

      This is a stateless intermediate operation on the left stream, and a stateful intermediate operation on the right stream. Upon close(), the returned stream closes both input streams.

      Parameters:
      right - the right-side stream
      onConfig - a function that configures the join condition
      selectConfig - a consumer that configures the output fields
      Returns:
      the new stream

    • rightJoin

      public RecordStream rightJoin(RecordStream right, Function<JoinAPI.On,JoinPred> onConfig, Consumer<JoinAPI.Select> selectConfig)
      Returns a stream that performs a right outer join between this (left) stream and the given right stream. The join streams the left-side, and for each left-side record, searches the right-side for matching records such that the (left, right) pair of records satisfy the configured join condition. When a match is found, a resulting record is created as configured and emitted downstream. The returned stream will have a new header, shared by the new records.

      For a right join, if a given left-side record does not match any right-side records, nothing is emitted downstream. If a right-side record does not match any left-side records, it is paired with a nil left-side record, and a resulting record is created as configured and emitted downstream.

      This is a stateless intermediate operation on the left stream, and a stateful intermediate operation on the right stream. Upon close(), the returned stream closes both input streams.

      Parameters:
      right - the right-side stream
      onConfig - a function that configures the join condition
      selectConfig - a consumer that configures the output fields
      Returns:
      the new stream

    • fullJoin

      public RecordStream fullJoin(RecordStream right, Function<JoinAPI.On,JoinPred> onConfig, Consumer<JoinAPI.Select> selectConfig)
      Returns a stream that performs a full outer join between this (left) stream and the given right stream. The join streams the left-side, and for each left-side record, searches the right-side for matching records such that the (left, right) pair of records satisfy the configured join condition. When a match is found, a resulting record is created as configured and emitted downstream. The returned stream will have a new header, shared by the new records.

      For a full join, if a given left-side record does not match any right-side records, or vice versa, the unmatched record is paired with a nil opposite-side record, and a resulting record is created as configured and emitted downstream.

      This is a stateless intermediate operation on the left stream, and a stateful intermediate operation on the right stream. Upon close(), the returned stream closes both input streams.

      Parameters:
      right - the right-side stream
      onConfig - a function that configures the join condition
      selectConfig - a consumer that configures the output fields
      Returns:
      the new stream

      Specified by:

    • sorted

      public RecordStream sorted()
      Returns a stream consisting of the records of this stream, sorted according to the natural order of each header field in turn (nulls first/lowest). If any header fields are not Comparable, a java.lang.ClassCastException may be thrown when the terminal operation is executed.

      For ordered streams, the sort is stable. For unordered streams, no stability guarantees are made.

      This is a stateful intermediate operation.

      Specified by:
      sorted in interface Stream<Record>
      Returns:
      the new stream
